channel.title: LQ Podcast
channel.description: Open Talk... about Open Source and Linux
channel.itunes:author: LinuxQuestions.org
channel.itunes:subtitle: Open Talk... about Open Source and Linux
channel.itunes:summary: The LQ Radio site is home to the LQ Podcast (a podcast about LQ, Linux and Open Source), the LQ Radio Show and the LQ Radio Interview Series. LQ Radio is Open Talk about Open Source and Linux.

item.title: LinuxQuestions.org Podcast - 06.29.06
item.dc:creator: lqradio@.linuxquestions.org (jeremy)
item.description: The latest LinuxQuestions.org Podcast. Topics include the addition of ogg links at LQ Radio, the six year LQ anniversary, Marvell buys Intel’s handheld processor unit, EU poised to rule against Microsoft, another Microsoft Exec jumps to Google and Google launches Checkout. LQ-Podcast-062906.mp3 ogg –jeremy Podcast, Linux, Open Source, Intel, EU, Microsoft, MSFT, Google, Checkout
item.content:encoded:

item.title: LinuxQuestions.org Podcast - 06.22.06
item.dc:creator: lqradio@.linuxquestions.org (jeremy)
item.description: The latest LinuxQuestions.org Podcast. Topics include Puppy Linux, the LQ Wiki, the TreoQuestions.org 20% of Software Sale, Novell Names Ron Hovsepian To Succeed Jack Messman as CEO, Why Oracle Isn’t a Member of the OSDL, Mundie Speaks on OSS and The Microsoft Exec Exodus. item.title: LinuxQuestions.org Podcast - 05.28.06
item.dc:creator: lqradio@.linuxquestions.org (jeremy)
item.description: The latest LinuxQuestions.org Podcast. Topics include new hardware at LinuxQuestions.org, a follow up to the Novell Linux Driver process, Red Hat’s take on the Sun Java distro license, Microsoft considers taking away admin rights from employees, the Mac OS X kernel being closed sourced, Google releases Picasa for Linux and the 25 worst tech products [...]
item.content:encoded:
The latest LinuxQuestions.org Podcast. Topics include new hardware at LinuxQuestions.org, a follow up to the Novell Linux Driver process, Red Hat’s take on the Sun Java distro license, Microsoft considers taking away admin rights from employees, the Mac OS X kernel being closed sourced, Google releases Picasa for Linux and the 25 worst tech products of all time.

LQ-Podcast-052806.mp3

–jeremy

Podcast,Linux,Open Source,Novell,Red Hat,Sun,Java,Microsoft,Google,Picasa,Apple
